meanings.definition: Practicing or advocating strict religious or moral behavior
meanings.sent1: The puritanic preacher condemned any form of entertainment.
meanings.sent2: Her puritanic beliefs led her to abstain from worldly pleasures.
meanings.sent3: The puritanic cat disapproved of the playful antics of the kittens.
meanings.sent4: His puritanic dedication to honesty made him a trustworthy friend.
meanings.sent5: The puritanic rules of the household left little room for fun or relaxation.

meanings.definition: Characterized by strict adherence to moral principles
meanings.sent1: The puritanic community frowned upon any deviation from tradition.
meanings.sent2: His puritanic lifestyle included daily prayer and meditation.
meanings.sent3: The puritanic squirrel hoarded nuts with unwavering determination.
meanings.sent4: The puritanic mountain stood tall and unwavering against the elements.
meanings.sent5: Her puritanic dedication to her studies earned her top grades in school.

meanings.definition: Having or showing a strict and moralistic attitude
meanings.sent1: The puritanic neighbor disapproved of any noise after 9 pm.
meanings.sent2: His puritanic views on marriage dictated a lifetime commitment.
meanings.sent3: The puritanic tree refused to bend even in the strongest winds.
meanings.sent4: Her puritanic dedication to fairness earned her respect from all.
meanings.sent5: The puritanic judge was known for delivering harsh but fair sentences.
